name: Generic Schooter
description:
Description

*Disclaimer* This game is in early development. I say that, but I've been working on it for ~6 months.  Expect bugs or  not fully fleshed out features. The bones are there though, so if you like the bones, let me know.

There is no story to this game, you load an arena and survive for as long as you can. You can find an arsenal of spells throughout the arena, leveling them up and swapping loadouts to slaughter the ever-growing mass of enemies. It doesn't matter how long you survive, only how many enemies you take down with you.

Controls

Controls are currently keyboard and mouse only, but controller support is planned

  • W, A, S, D  to move
  • Shift to sprint
  • Spacebar to jump
  • Mouse to rotate character
  • Left click to cast the equipped spell
  • Right click switches to aiming mode, with a reticle appearing to help target
  • 1, 2, and 3 switch between spells on your spell bar
  • 1, 2, and 3 also purchases spells and equips them to the corresponding bar
Enemies

This game will have a variety of units, spawning in increasing numbers and increasing varieties the longer a player survives. Different arenas will have different enemies in each of the 7 classes available. The 7 classes will be divided as follows:

  • Infantry - Kobolds: Fodder units
  • Ranged - Goblins: Fodder units that attack from afar
  • Heavy Infantry - Hobgoblins: Meaty units that hit hard and move slow
  • Berserker - Werewolves: Heavy hitters that move fast and go down faster *Not Spawning*
  • Cavalry - Chimeras: Large units with a variety of attacks *Not Spawning*
  • Siege - Golems: Very slow, very tanky, long reach *In Development*
  • Boss - TBD: Special Attacks and Special Stats *In Planning*
In The Future

This is an ongoing project, with features planned and in the works. I started this project as way to test my ability to integrate Asset Workshop bundles and stretch my skills as a coder.  Some planned features will be dependent on player interest, while others will be implemented by me to continue my practice. If you have any suggestions, feel free to leave them in the comments. This is supposed to be a power fantasy game, so go crazy.
